title: Test
yAxis: Inflation rate compared to previous year
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Inflation rate compared to previous year, with a total of 41 data points.
Overall Inflation rate compared to previous year has decreased over the Year

Inflation rate compared to previous year is roughly constant from 1984 to 1985, rapidly decreasing from 1985 to 1986, rapidly increasing from 1986 to 1989, roughly constant from 1989 to 1990, rapidly increasing from 1990 to 1992, roughly constant from 1992 to 1993, rapidly decreasing from 1993 to 1996, roughly constant from 1996 to 1997, rapidly decreasing from 1997 to 1998, roughly constant from 1998 to 1999, rapidly increasing from 1999 to 2001, gradually decreasing from 2001 to 2002, roughly constant from 2002 to 2003, rapidly increasing from 2003 to 2004, roughly constant from 2004 to 2006, slightly increasing from 2006 to 2007, rapidly decreasing from 2007 to 2009, rapidly increasing from 2009 to 2011, roughly constant from 2011 to 2012, rapidly decreasing from 2012 to 2014, roughly constant from 2014 to 2015, gradually decreasing from 2015 to 2016, rapidly increasing from 2016 to 2017, roughly constant from 2017 to 2018, slightly decreasing from 2018 to 2019, and lastly gradually constant from 2019 to 2024.
The steepest decrease occurs in between the Year 2008 and 2009.
Max Inflation rate compared to previous year about 5.05 was recorded at Year 1992
Min Inflation rate compared to previous year about 0.13 was recorded at Year 1986
This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Inflation rate compared to previous year, with a total of 41 data points. The chart has 7 significant trends.
The longest trend is moderately decreasing which exists from 2011 to 2019.
But, the next significant trend is slightly increasing which exists from 1990 to 1996.
Also, the next significant trend is extremely decreasing which exists from 1984 to 1990.
Differently, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2019 to 2024.
Also, the next significant trend is moderately increasing which exists from 2006 to 2011.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is extremely decreasing which exists from 2001 to 2006.
Conversely, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 1996 to 2001.
